DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Diagnostic procedure , radionuclide image use bispecific antibody , may help find colorectal cancer cell learn extent disease . PURPOSE : This phase I trial study well bispecific antibody work find tumor cell patient colorectal cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Bispecific Antibody Finding Tumor Cells Patients With Colorectal Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Assess pharmacokinetics tissue distribution anti-CEA x anti-HSG bispecific monoclonal antibody TF2 patient colorectal cancer . OUTLINE : This multicenter study . Patients receive iodine I 131-labeled anti-CEA x anti-HSG bispecific monoclonal antibody TF2 ( ^131I-TF2 ) IV 10-20 minute day 1 . Patients also undergo whole-body external scintigraphy various time study . Blood sample collect baseline periodically ^131I-TF2 infusion pharmacokinetic study ^131I-TF2 biodistribution ELISA radioactivity measurement .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Histologically confirm colorectal cancer Radiological documentation disease prefer , require PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Karnofsky performance status 70100 % Life expectancy ≥ 3 month WBC ≥ 3,000/mm³ Neutrophil count ≥ 1,500/mm³ Platelet count ≥ 100,000/mm³ Serum creatinine normal Bilirubin ≤ 1.5 time upper limit normal ( ULN ) AST/ALT < 2 time ULN Not pregnant nursing Fertile patient must use effective contraception 1 month completion study therapy No medical condition might prevent full participation protocolrequired test followup No institutionalized patient ( e.g. , prison mental health institution ) PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : No concurrent chemotherapy treatment would compromise safety efficacy protocol assessment
